articles.title: 50 Essensielle Ukrainske Fraser for Par for √Ö Knytte B√•nd
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

N√•r du elsker noen fra Ukraina, blir hvert ord p√• ukrainsk en mulighet til √• komme n√¶rmere deres hjerte. Disse 50 essensielle setningene vil hjelpe deg √• uttrykke kj√¶rlighet, omsorg og forst√•else p√• deres morsm√•l. Enten du akkurat har startet √• l√¶re ukrainsk sammen med partneren din, eller du vil overraske dem med romantiske fraser, vil disse setningene styrke deres spesielle b√•nd.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  translation="Jeg elsker deg"
  pronunciation="Ya te-be ko-kha-yu"
  context="Den viktigste setningen - si det med √∏yenkontakt og et varmt smil"
/>

## De f√∏rste 10: Hjertets fundament

Disse ti setningene danner grunnlaget for kj√¶rlig kommunikasjon. √òv p√• dem sammen, og bruk dem daglig!

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á"
  translation="God natt"
  pronunciation="Dob-rah-nich"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á, –º–æ—è –ª—é–±–æ–≤. (God natt, min kj√¶rlighet.)"
/>

| Ukrainsk | Norsk | Uttale | N√•r du bruker det |
|----------|--------|----------|-------------------|
| **–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é** | Jeg elsker deg | Ya te-be ko-kha-yu | Hver dag, n√•r som helst |
| **–¢–∏ –º–µ–Ω—ñ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–µ–Ω/–ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–∞** | Jeg trenger deg | Ti me-ni po-tri-ben/po-tri-bna | N√•r du savner dem |
| **–¢–∏ —Ç–∞–∫–∞ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–∞** | Du er s√• vakker | Ti tah-kah kra-see-vah | Til henne (spesielle √∏yeblikk) |
| **–¢–∏ —Ç–∞–∫–∏–π handsome** | Du er s√• kjekk | Ti tah-keey hahn-some | Til ham (med et smil) |
| **–î—è–∫—É—é** | Takk | Dya-ku-yu | For alt de gj√∏r |
| **–í–∏–±–∞—á** | Unnskyld | Vi-bach | N√•r du tar feil |
| **–Ø –ø–∏—à–∞—é—Å—å —Ç–æ–±–æ—é** | Jeg er stolt av deg | Ya pee-sha-yu-sy to-bo-yu | For deres prestasjoner |
| **–¢–∏ –º–æ—î —â–∞—Å—Ç—è** | Du er min lykke | Ti mo-ye shchas-tya | Romantiske √∏yeblikk |
| **–û–±—ñ–π–º–∏ –º–µ–Ω–µ** | Klem meg | O-biy-my me-ne | N√•r du trenger en klem |
| **–¶—ñ–ª—É—é —Ç–µ–±–µ** | Jeg kysser deg | Tsee-lu-yu te-be | Avskjed eller hilsen |

<CultureTip flag="üá∫üá¶" title="Kj√¶rlighetens spr√•k">
Ukrainere verdsetter dype, meningsfulle samtaler. Ta deg tid til √• lytte n√•r partneren din snakker - det viser respekt og kj√¶rlighet.
</CultureTip>

## Romantiske uttrykk: Hjertets melodi

Disne setningene vil smelte hjertet til ukrainske partneren din. Perfekt for [spesielle anledninger](/learn/no/uk/romantic-ukrainian-phrases-for-every-occasion/)!

| Ukrainsk | Norsk | Uttale |
|----------|--------|----------|
| **–¢–∏ –º–æ—î —Å–æ–Ω—Ü–µ** | Du er min sol | Ti mo-ye son-tse |
| **–ë–µ–∑ —Ç–µ–±–µ —è –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂—É** | Jeg kan ikke uten deg | Bez te-be ya ne mo-zhu |
| **–¢–∏ –º–æ—è –∑—ñ—Ä–æ—á–∫–∞** | Du er min stjerne | Ti mo-ya zee-roch-kah |
| **–ó —Ç–æ–±–æ—é –º–µ–Ω—ñ –¥–æ–±—Ä–µ** | Jeg har det bra med deg | Z to-bo-yu me-ni do-bre |
| **–¢–∏ –º–æ—î –≤—Å–µ** | Du er mitt alt | Ti mo-ye vse |

## Hverdagskj√¶rlighet: Sm√• √∏yeblikk, stor betydning

Disse setningene passer perfekt i daglige samtaler og viser at du bryr deg om de sm√• tingene.

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–π—à–æ–≤ —Ç–≤—ñ–π –¥–µ–Ω—å?"
  translation="Hvordan var dagen din?"
  pronunciation="Yak proy-shov tveey den'?"
  example="Sp√∏r dette hver kveld - det viser ekte interesse"
/>

### Morgen og kveld

- **–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–Ω–∫—É, –ª—é–±–∏–π/–ª—é–±–∞** (God morgen, kj√¶re) - dob-ro-ho rahn-ku, lyu-beey/lyu-bah
- **–ü—Ä–∏—î–º–Ω–∏—Ö —Å–Ω—ñ–≤** (S√∏te dr√∏mmer) - pree-yem-neech sneev
- **–°–ø–∏ –¥–æ–±—Ä–µ** (Sov godt) - spee do-bre

### Omsorg og st√∏tte

| Ukrainsk | Norsk | Uttale |
|----------|--------|----------|
| **–Ø —Ç—É—Ç** | Jeg er her | Ya tut |
| **–í—Å–µ –±—É–¥–µ –¥–æ–±—Ä–µ** | Alt vil bli bra | Vse bu-de do-bre |
| **–Ø –≤—ñ—Ä—é –≤ —Ç–µ–±–µ** | Jeg tror p√• deg | Ya veer-yu v te-be |
| **–¢–∏ –∑–º–æ–∂–µ—à** | Du klarer det | Ti zmo-zhesh |
| **–ù–µ —Ö–≤–∏–ª—é–π—Å—è** | Ikke bekymre deg | Ne hvee-lyuys-ya |

## Komplimenter og beundring

Ukrainere setter pris p√• oppriktige komplimenter. Bruk disse for √• [gj√∏re partneren din glad](/learn/no/uk/ukrainian-pet-names-for-your-partner/)!

| Ukrainsk | Norsk | Uttale |
|----------|--------|----------|
| **–¢–∏ —Ä–æ–∑—É–º–Ω–∏–π/—Ä–æ–∑—É–º–Ω–∞** | Du er smart | Ti ro-zoom-neey/ro-zoom-nah |
| **–£ —Ç–µ–±–µ –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Å–º—ñ—à–∫–∞** | Du har et fint smil | U te-be hahr-nah pos-meesh-kah |
| **–¢–∏ –¥–æ–±—Ä–∏–π/–¥–æ–±—Ä–∞** | Du er snill | Ti do-breey/do-brah |
| **–¢–∏ —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–∏–π/—Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–∞** | Du er sterk | Ti seel'-neey/seel'-nah |
| **–¢–∏ –Ω–∞—Ç—Ö–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–π/–Ω–∞—Ç—Ö–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–∞** | Du er inspirerende | Ti naht-hnen-neey/naht-hnen-nah |

<CultureTip flag="üá∫üá¶" title="Kompliment-kultur">
I Ukraina er det vanlig √• gi komplimenter om utseende, intelligens og karakter. V√¶r spesifikk - generelle komplimenter virker mindre oppriktige.
</CultureTip>

## Planlegging og fremtid

Snakk om fremtiden sammen med disse setningene som bygger h√•p og felles dr√∏mmer.

<VocabCard
  word="–ú–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–º–æ —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º"
  translation="Vi skal tilbringe sammen"
  pronunciation="Mee pro-ve-de-mo razom"
  example="–ú–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–º–æ —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º —É–≤–µ—Å—å –≤—ñ–∫–µ–∫. (Vi skal tilbringe hele livet sammen.)"
/>

### Felles planer

- **–î–∞–≤–∞–π –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ–Ω–µ–º–æ—Å—å** (La oss m√∏tes) - dah-vahy zoo-stree-ne-mos'
- **–©–æ —Ä–æ–±–∏–º–æ —Å—å–æ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—ñ?** (Hva skal vi gj√∏re i dag?) - shcho ro-bee-mo s'ohod-nee?
- **–ö—É–¥–∏ –ø—ñ–¥–µ–º–æ?** (Hvor skal vi dra?) - ku-dee pee-de-mo?

### Dr√∏mmer og h√•p

| Ukrainsk | Norsk | Uttale |
|----------|--------|----------|
| **–Ø –º—Ä—ñ—é –ø—Ä–æ –Ω–∞—Å** | Jeg dr√∏mmer om oss | Ya mree-yu pro nahs |
| **–ù–∞—à–µ –º–∞–π–±—É—Ç–Ω—î** | V√•r fremtid | Nah-she mahy-boot-nye |
| **–†–∞–∑–æ–º –Ω–∞–∑–∞–≤–∂–¥–∏** | Sammen for alltid | Razom nah-zahv-zhdi |

## Hvordan bruke disse setningene sammen

### Daglig praksis
Velg 3-5 nye setninger hver uke. √òv p√• dem under [koselige middager](/learn/no/uk/ukrainian-date-night-vocabulary/) eller g√•turer. Gj√∏r det til en lek - hvem husker flest?

### V√¶r t√•lmodig
Ukrainsk grammatikk kan v√¶re utfordrende med sine kasus, men fokuser f√∏rst p√• uttalen og betydningen. Din partner vil sette pris p√• innsatsen uansett!

### Lag romantiske √∏yeblikk
Skriv favoritt-setningene p√• lapper og legg dem i lommeboken, speilet eller telefonen. Bruk dem som [sm√• kj√¶rlighetserkl√¶ringer](/learn/no/uk/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-ukrainian/) gjennom dagen.

<CultureTip flag="üá∫üá¶" title="Kroppsspr√•k betyr alt">
N√•r du sier disse setningene, hold √∏yenkontakt og smil. Ukrainere er veldig uttrykksfulle - la f√∏lelsene dine synes i ansiktet og stemmen."
</CultureTip>

Disse 50 essensielle setningene er bare begynnelsen p√• deres spr√•klige reise sammen. Hver gang du bruker ukrainsk med partneren din, bygger du en dypere forbindelse som overg√•r ord. V√¶r modig, gj√∏r feil med et smil, og husk - kj√¶rlighetens spr√•k forst√•r alle hjerter.

<CTA />

articles.title: 75+ Romantik Ingilizce Ifade: Kalbini Fethet
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Hayat, romantik ifadeler gerektiren sayisiz anla doludur. Gunluk sevgi gosteriminden ozel kutlamalara kadar, dogru kelimeleri bilmek iliskinizi zenginlestirir. Bu rehberde, her durum icin kullanabileceginiz romantik Ingilizce ifadeler bulacaksiniz.

## Gunluk Sevgi Ifadeleri

<PhraseOfDay
  word="I love you more every day"
  translation="Her gun seni daha cok seviyorum"
  pronunciation="ay lav yu mor ev-ri dey"
  context="Askinizin buyudugunu ifade etmek icin"
/>

### Sabah Ifadeleri

<VocabCard
  word="Waking up next to you is the best part of my day"
  translation="Yaninda uyanmak gunumun en guzel kƒ±smi"
  pronunciation="vey-king ap nekst tu yu iz de best part ov may dey"
  example="Good morning, beautiful. Waking up next to you is the best part of my day."
/>

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **Good morning, gorgeous** | Gunaydin, guzelim |
| **I dreamed about you** | Seni ruyamda gordum |
| **You're my sunshine** | Sen benim gunesimsin |
| **Have a beautiful day, my love** | Guzel bir gun gecir, askim |

### Aksam Ifadeleri

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **I've been thinking about you all day** | Butun gun seni dusundum |
| **Coming home to you is the best feeling** | Sana eve donmek en guzel his |
| **I missed you today** | Bugun seni ozledim |
| **Let's just cuddle tonight** | Bu gece sadece sarƒ±lalƒ±m |

## Yildonumu Ifadeleri

<VocabCard
  word="Happy anniversary, my love"
  translation="Mutlu yildonumu, askim"
  pronunciation="he-pi e-ni-ver-se-ri, may lav"
  example="Happy anniversary, my love. These have been the best years of my life."
/>

### Yildonumu Mesajlari

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **Thank you for [sayƒ±] amazing years** | [Sayi] harika yil icin tesekkurler |
| **I'd marry you all over again** | Seninle tekrar evlenirdim |
| **Every moment with you has been a blessing** | Seninle her an bir nimet |
| **Here's to many more years together** | Daha nice yillara birlikte |
| **You're still the one I want** | Hala istedigim tek kisi sensin |

<CultureTip title="Yildonumu Kutlama" flag="üá∫üá∏">
Ingilizce konusan kulturlerde yildonumleri genellikle kart, hediye ve romantik aksam yemegi ile kutlanir. "Paper anniversary" (1 yil), "silver" (25 yil) ve "golden" (50 yil) ozel isimler tasir.
</CultureTip>

## Sevgililer Gunu

<VocabCard
  word="Be my Valentine"
  translation="Sevgilim ol"
  pronunciation="bi may va-len-tayn"
  example="Will you be my Valentine this year?"
/>

### Sevgililer Gunu Mesajlari

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **You make every day feel like Valentine's Day** | Her gun Sevgililer Gunu gibi hissettiriyorsun |
| **My heart beats only for you** | Kalbim sadece senin icin atiyor |
| **You're the love story I always wanted** | Hep istedigim ask hikayesisin |
| **Forever and always, I choose you** | Sonsuza kadar, hep seni seciyorum |
| **You had me at hello** | Ilk merhabada beni kazandin |

## Dogum Gunu Mesajlari

<VocabCard
  word="Happy birthday to the love of my life"
  translation="Hayatimin askina mutlu yillar"
  pronunciation="he-pi bert-dey tu de lav ov may layf"
  example="Happy birthday to the love of my life. You deserve all the happiness."
/>

### Romantik Dogum Gunu Dilekleri

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **May all your wishes come true** | Tum dileklerin gercek olsun |
| **I'm so grateful you were born** | Dogdugun icin cok minnettarim |
| **Another year of loving you** | Seni sevmenin bir yili daha |
| **You only get better with age** | Yasla birlikte daha da guzellesiyorsun |
| **Today is all about you** | Bugun tamamen senin icin |

## Evlenme Teklifi

<VocabCard
  word="Will you marry me?"
  translation="Benimle evlenir misin?"
  pronunciation="vil yu me-ri mi"
  example="I've loved you since the moment I saw you. Will you marry me?"
/>

### Teklif Ifadeleri

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **I want to spend the rest of my life with you** | Hayatimin geri kalanini seninle gecirmek istiyorum |
| **You complete me** | Sen beni tamamliyorsun |
| **I can't imagine my life without you** | Sensiz hayatimi hayal edemiyorum |
| **You're my best friend and my soulmate** | Sen hem en iyi arkadasim hem ruh esimsin |
| **I promise to love you forever** | Seni sonsuza dek sevecegime soz veriyorum |

<CultureTip title="Evlenme Teklifi Gelenegi" flag="üá¨üáß">
Bati kulturlerinde evlenme teklifi genellikle tek diz uzerine cokerek yapilir. "Get down on one knee" (tek diz cok) romantik teklif gelenegidir. Yuzuk genellikle sol elin yuzuk parmagina takilir.
</CultureTip>

## Dugun Gunu

### Yemin Ifadeleri

<VocabCard
  word="I take you to be my partner for life"
  translation="Seni hayat boyu partnerim olarak kabul ediyorum"
  pronunciation="ay teyk yu tu bi may part-ner for layf"
  example="I take you to be my partner for life, in joy and in sorrow."
/>

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **To have and to hold** | Sahip olmak ve tutmak icin |
| **In sickness and in health** | Hastalikta ve saglikta |
| **Till death do us part** | Olum bizi ayirana kadar |
| **I do** | Evet, kabul ediyorum |
| **With this ring, I thee wed** | Bu yuzukle seninle evleniyorum |

## Ozur ve Baris

<VocabCard
  word="I'm sorry I hurt you"
  translation="Seni incitigim icin ozur dilerim"
  pronunciation="aym so-ri ay hert yu"
  example="I'm sorry I hurt you. Please forgive me."
/>

### Ozur Ifadeleri

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **I was wrong and I'm sorry** | Yanlistim ve ozur dilerim |
| **Can we start fresh?** | Temiz bir sayfa acabilir miyiz? |
| **I never meant to hurt you** | Seni incitmek niyetinde degimdim |
| **You mean more to me than winning this argument** | Benim icin bu tartismayi kazanmaktan daha degirsin |
| **I love you, and that's what matters most** | Seni seviyorum, en onemli olan bu |

## Teselli ve Destek

<VocabCard
  word="I'm here for you, no matter what"
  translation="Ne olursa olsun senin icin buradayim"
  pronunciation="aym hir for yu, no me-ter vat"
  example="I know things are hard right now. I'm here for you, no matter what."
/>

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **Everything will be okay** | Her sey iyi olacak |
| **We'll get through this together** | Bunu birlikte atlatacagiz |
| **I believe in you** | Sana inaniyorum |
| **Lean on me** | Bana yaslan |
| **I'm not going anywhere** | Bir yere gitmiyorum |

## Uzun Mesafe Iliski

<VocabCard
  word="Distance means nothing when someone means everything"
  translation="Biri her sey demekse mesafe hic bir sey demektir"
  pronunciation="dis-tens minz na-ting ven sam-van minz ev-ri-ting"
  example="I miss you so much, but distance means nothing when someone means everything."
/>

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **I can't wait to see you again** | Seni tekrar gormek icin sab√≠rsizlaniyorum |
| **You're worth the wait** | Beklemeye degersin |
| **Every day without you feels like forever** | Sensiz her gun sonsuzluk gibi |
| **Soon we'll be together again** | Yakinda tekrar birlikte olacagiz |
| **I carry you in my heart** | Seni kalbimde tasiyorum |

## Ozel Anlar

### Birlikte Seyahat

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **I love making memories with you** | Seninle anƒ±lar biriktirmeyi seviyorum |
| **Everywhere is better with you** | Her yer seninle daha guzel |
| **This is our adventure** | Bu bizim maceramiz |
| **I'll follow you anywhere** | Seni her yere takip ederim |

### Sessiz Anlar

| Ingilizce | Turkce |
|-----------|--------|
| **I love just being with you** | Sadece seninle olmaktan mutluyum |
| **Your presence calms me** | Varligin beni sakinlestiriyor |
| **Silence with you is comfortable** | Seninle sessizlik rahat |
| **You're my peace** | Sen benim huzurumsun |

## Klasik Romantik Ifadeler

<VocabCard
  word="You had me at hello"
  translation="Ilk merhabada beni kazandin"
  pronunciation="yu hed mi et he-lo"
  example="From the moment I met you, you had me at hello."
/>

| Ingilizce | Turkce | Kaynak |
|-----------|--------|--------|
| **You complete me** | Beni tamamliyorsun | Jerry Maguire |
| **I'm yours** | Seninim | - |
| **You're the one** | Sen o kisisin | The Matrix |
| **Always and forever** | Her zaman ve sonsuza dek | - |
| **My heart is yours** | Kalbim senin | - |

Romantik ifadeler, iliskinize derinlik ve anlam katar. Bu ifadeleri dogru anlarda kullanarak partnerinize ne kadar ozel oldugunu hissettirebilirsiniz.

## √ñƒürenmeye Devam Et

- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Telaffuz](/learn/tr/en/english-pronunciation-guide/)** - Sesleri √∂ƒürenin
- **[Temel ƒ∞ngilizce ƒ∞fadeler](/learn/tr/en/english-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Pratik ileti≈üim
- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Zor mu?](/learn/tr/en/is-english-hard-to-learn/)** - D√ºr√ºst analiz
- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Selamla≈ümalar](/learn/tr/en/english-greetings-farewells/)** - Temel konu≈üma

<CTA
  text="ƒ∞ngilizce partnerinle birlikte √∂ƒürenmeye hazƒ±r mƒ±sƒ±n? AI sesli sohbet ile pratik yap, Love Log'a ifadeler kaydet ve partnerin senin √∂ƒüretmenin olabilir. ƒ∞ki dilli √ßiftler i√ßin m√ºkemmel!"
  buttonText="≈ûimdi Ba≈üla"
/>

articles.title: 50 Niemieckich Powita≈Ñ i Po≈ºegna≈Ñ dla Par: Od Cze≈õƒá do Do Widzenia z Mi≈Ço≈õciƒÖ
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Pierwsze wra≈ºenie jest kluczowe, zw≈Çaszcza gdy spotykasz siƒô z rodzinƒÖ Twojego niemieckiego partnera! Odpowiednie powitanie mo≈ºe otworzyƒá drzwi do ciep≈Çych relacji i pokazaƒá, ≈ºe naprawdƒô siƒô starasz. Te 50 niemieckich powita≈Ñ i po≈ºegna≈Ñ pomo≈ºe Wam obojgu czuƒá siƒô pewnie w ka≈ºdej sytuacji ‚Äì od codziennego "cze≈õƒá" po oficjalne spotkania z przysz≈Çymi te≈õciami.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ich liebe dich"
  translation="Kocham ciƒô"
  pronunciation="ikh LEE-beh dikh"
  context="Najpiƒôkniejsze po≈ºegnanie ‚Äì powiedz to przed odej≈õciem, by zostawiƒá u≈õmiech na twarzy Twojego partnera."
/>

## Codzienne Powitania: Od Rana do Wieczora

Tych podstawowych powita≈Ñ u≈ºywacie codziennie ‚Äì warto je opanowaƒá do perfekcji! Niemcy doceniajƒÖ, gdy siƒô starasz, nawet je≈õli akcent nie jest idealny.

<VocabCard
  word="Hallo"
  translation="Cze≈õƒá/witaj"
  pronunciation="HAH-loh"
  example="Hallo, mein Schatz! Wie war dein Tag?"
/>

| Niemiecki | Polski | Wymowa | Kiedy u≈ºywaƒá |
|-----------|---------|---------|--------------|
| **Hallo** | Cze≈õƒá | HAH-loh | Uniwersalne, zawsze bezpieczne |
| **Hi** | Hej | hahy | Nieformalne, z przyjaci√≥≈Çmi |
| **Guten Morgen** | Dzie≈Ñ dobry | GOO-ten MOR-gen | Do po≈Çudnia (do 12:00) |
| **Guten Tag** | Dzie≈Ñ dobry | GOO-ten tahk | Po po≈Çudniu (12:00-18:00) |
| **Guten Abend** | Dobry wiecz√≥r | GOO-ten AH-bent | Po 18:00 |
| **Wie geht's?** | Jak leci? | vee geyts? | Nieformalne "jak siƒô masz?" |
| **Wie geht es dir?** | Jak siƒô masz? | vee geyt es deer? | Bardziej formalnie |
| **Alles klar?** | Wszystko jasne? | AH-les klahr? | Zwyczajowe "co s≈Çychaƒá?" |
| **Na, wie geht's?** | No, co s≈Çychaƒá? | nah vee geyts? | Bardzo nieformalnie |

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá™" title="Czas ma znaczenie!">
Niemcy sƒÖ dok≈Çadni ‚Äì "Guten Morgen" u≈ºywaj tylko przed po≈Çudniem! Po 12:00 przejd≈∫ do "Guten Tag", a po 18:00 do "Guten Abend".
</CultureTip>

## Romantyczne Powitania: Dla Dwojga

Spraw, by ka≈ºde powitanie by≈Ço wyjƒÖtkowe! Te s≈Çowa dodadzƒÖ ciep≈Ça Waszym codziennym spotkaniom.

<VocabCard
  word="Mein Schatz"
  translation="M√≥j skarbie"
  pronunciation="myn shahts"
  example="Hallo, mein Schatz! Ich habe dich vermisst."
/>

| Niemiecki | Polski | Wymowa | Kontekst romantyczny |
|-----------|---------|---------|----------------------|
| **Hallo, Liebling** | Cze≈õƒá, kochanie | HAH-loh LEE-bling | Codzienne, czu≈Çe |
| **Guten Morgen, Sch√∂nheit** | Dzie≈Ñ dobry, ≈õliczna | GOO-ten MOR-gen SHERN-hyt | Rano, budzƒÖc partnera |
| **Hey, S√º√üe/S√º√üer** | Hej, s≈Çodziaku | hahy Z√ú-seh/Z√ú-ser | Bardzo intymnie |
| **Hallo, mein Herz** | Cze≈õƒá, moje serce | HAH-loh myn herts | G≈Çƒôboko uczuciowe |
| **Guten Tag, meine Liebe** | Dzie≈Ñ dobry, moja mi≈Ço≈õƒá | GOO-ten tahk MY-neh LEE-beh | Formalnie, ale romantycznie |

Chcesz wiƒôcej romantycznych zwrot√≥w? Sprawd≈∫ [niemieckie zwroty mi≈Çosne na ka≈ºdƒÖ okazjƒô](/learn/pl/de/romantic-german-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

## Po≈ºegnania na Ka≈ºdƒÖ Okazjƒô

Niemieckie po≈ºegnania mogƒÖ byƒá r√≥wnie ciep≈Çe co powitania ‚Äì oto jak zostawiƒá dobre wra≈ºenie!

### Codzienne Po≈ºegnania

| Niemiecki | Polski | Wymowa | Kiedy u≈ºywaƒá |
|-----------|---------|---------|--------------|
| **Tsch√ºss** | Pa/Cze≈õƒá | ch√ºss | Standardowe, uniwersalne |
| **Ciao** | Cze≈õƒá | chow | Nieformalne, m≈Çodzie≈ºowe |
| **Bis sp√§ter** | Do p√≥≈∫niej | bis SHPAY-ter | Gdy wr√≥cisz tego samego dnia |
| **Bis gleich** | Do zaraz | bis glykh | Jeszcze dzi≈õ siƒô spotkacie |
| **Bis morgen** | Do jutra | bis MOR-gen | Spotkanie jutro |
| **Mach's gut** | Trzymaj siƒô | mahkhs goot | Troskliwe po≈ºegnanie |
| **Gute Nacht** | Dobranoc | GOO-teh nakht | Przed snem |

### Formalne Po≈ºegnania

<VocabCard
  word="Auf Wiedersehen"
  translation="Do widzenia"
  pronunciation="owf VEE-der-zey-en"
  example="Es war sch√∂n, Sie kennenzulernen. Auf Wiedersehen!"
/>

- **Auf Wiedersehen** ‚Äì Do widzenia (owf VEE-der-zey-en) ‚Äì Standard formalne
- **Guten Tag noch** ‚Äì Jeszcze dobrego dnia (GOO-ten tahk nokh) ‚Äì ≈ªyczenie mi≈Çego dnia
- **Sch√∂nen Tag noch** ‚Äì Mi≈Çego dnia (SHER-nen tahk nokh) ‚Äì Sympatyczne
- **Freundliche Gr√º√üe** ‚Äì Z powa≈ºaniem (FROYNT-likh-eh GR√ú-seh) ‚Äì W listach/mailach

## Emocjonalne Po≈ºegnania: Gdy Trudno Siƒô Rozstaƒá

Te wyjƒÖtkowe po≈ºegnania sprawiƒÖ, ≈ºe Tw√≥j partner poczuje siƒô kochany i doceniony.

| Niemiecki | Polski | Wymowa | Moment u≈ºycia |
|-----------|---------|---------|---------------|
| **Ich vermisse dich schon** | Ju≈º za TobƒÖ tƒôskniƒô | ikh fer-MISS-eh dikh shohn | Gdy siƒô rozstajecie |
| **Denk an mich** | My≈õl o mnie | denk ahn mikh | S≈Çodkie przypomnienie |
| **Komm sicher nach Hause** | Wr√≥ƒá bezpiecznie do domu | kohm ZIKH-er nahkh HOW-zeh | Troska o bezpiecze≈Ñstwo |
| **Schlaf gut, mein Schatz** | ≈öpij dobrze, m√≥j skarbie | shlahf goot myn shahts | Przed snem |
| **Tr√§um von mir** | ≈önij o mnie | TROYM fon meer | Romantyczna noc |

Planujecie wiecz√≥r we dwoje? Koniecznie sprawd≈∫cie [s≈Çownictwo na niemiecki wiecz√≥r randkowy](/learn/pl/de/german-date-night-vocabulary/).

## Specjalne Okazje: ≈öwiƒôta i Uroczysto≈õci

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá™" title="≈öwiƒÖteczne powitania">
W Niemczech na ≈õwiƒôta u≈ºywa siƒô specjalnych powita≈Ñ: "Frohe Weihnachten" (Weso≈Çych ≈öwiƒÖt) lub "Frohes Fest" (Weso≈Çych ≈öwiƒÖt). Zawsze dodaj imiƒô osoby, kt√≥rƒÖ witasz!
</CultureTip>

### ≈öwiƒÖteczne i Okoliczno≈õciowe

- **Frohe Weihnachten** ‚Äì Weso≈Çych ≈öwiƒÖt (FRO-heh VY-nakht-en)
- **Frohes neues Jahr** ‚Äì Szczƒô≈õliwego Nowego Roku (FRO-hehs NOY-es yahr)
- **Herzlichen Gl√ºckwunsch** ‚Äì Serdeczne gratulacje (HERTS-likh-en GL√úK-voonsh)
- **Alles Gute zum Geburtstag** ‚Äì Wszystkiego najlepszego z okazji urodzin (AH-les GOO-teh tsoom geh-BURTS-tahg)
- **Gute Besserung** ‚Äì Zdrowia (GOO-teh BESS-eh-roong) ‚Äì Gdy kto≈õ jest chory

## Zwroty Grzeczno≈õciowe: Dobre Maniery

Dodaj te zwroty do swoich powita≈Ñ i po≈ºegna≈Ñ, by zaimponowaƒá rodzinie Twojego partnera!

<VocabCard
  word="Freut mich, Sie kennenzulernen"
  translation="Mi≈Ço mi Ciƒô poznaƒá"
  pronunciation="FROYt mikh zee KEN-en-tsu-ler-nen"
  example="Freut mich, Sie kennenzulernen, Frau Schmidt!"
/>

| Niemiecki | Polski | Wymowa |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| **Wie hei√üen Sie?** | Jak siƒô nazywa Pan/Pani? | vee HY-sen zee |
| **Es freut mich** | Cieszƒô siƒô | es FROYt mikh |
| **Angenehm** | Mi≈Ço (skr√≥t) | ahng-geh-NEHM |
| **Gleichfalls** | R√≥wnie≈º | GLYKH-fahls |
| **Danke gleichfalls** | Dziƒôkujƒô, r√≥wnie≈º | DAHN-ke GLYKH-fahls |
| **Vielen Dank** | Bardzo dziƒôkujƒô | FEE-len dahnk |

## Praktyczne Wskaz√≥wki dla Par

### Jak ƒÜwiczyƒá Razem

1. **Rytua≈Ç poranny**: Zawsze witajcie siƒô po niemiecku ‚Äì "Guten Morgen, Liebling!"
2. **Po≈ºegnanie przed pracƒÖ**: Praktykujcie "Ich vermisse dich schon"
3. **Powitanie po pracy**: U≈ºywajcie "Wie war dein Tag?" (Jak by≈Ç Tw√≥j dzie≈Ñ?)
4. **Przed snem**: "Gute Nacht, schlaf gut" ‚Äì stw√≥rzcie w≈Çasny rytua≈Ç

### Najczƒôstsze B≈Çƒôdy do Unikniƒôcia

- Nie u≈ºywaj "Guten Morgen" po po≈Çudniu!
- "Tsch√ºss" jest neutralne ‚Äì nie u≈ºywaj z szefem
- "Ciao" jest tylko dla przyjaci√≥≈Ç, nie dla oficjalnych spotka≈Ñ
- Pamiƒôtaj o dostosowaniu formy: "du" (nieformalnie) vs "Sie" (formalnie)

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá™" title="U≈õcisk d≈Çoni vs poca≈Çunek">
W Niemczech standardem jest u≈õcisk d≈Çoni przy poznaniu. Poca≈Çunek w policzek zarezerwowany jest dla bliskich przyjaci√≥≈Ç i rodziny ‚Äì nie witaj tak szefa!
</CultureTip>

## Podsumowanie: Od Cze≈õƒá do Kocham Ciƒô

Opanowanie niemieckich powita≈Ñ i po≈ºegna≈Ñ to wiƒôcej ni≈º tylko s≈Çowa ‚Äì to klucz do serca kultury niemieckiej i Twojego partnera. Ka≈ºde "Hallo" i "Tsch√ºss" jest okazjƒÖ do pokazania troski i szacunku. ƒÜwiczcie razem, wspierajcie siƒô nawzajem, a zobaczycie, jak te proste zwroty zbli≈ºajƒÖ Was do siebie i do rodziny Waszego partnera.

Pamiƒôtaj: perfekcyjna wymowa przyjdzie z czasem. To, co liczy siƒô najbardziej, to autentyczna chƒôƒá po≈ÇƒÖczenia siƒô z drugƒÖ osobƒÖ. Wasza mi≈Ço≈õƒá do siebie nawzajem jest najlepszƒÖ motywacjƒÖ do nauki!

<CTA />

articles.title: Accord des Adjectifs Polonais
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

L'un des aspects les plus difficiles de la grammaire polonaise est de faire accorder les adjectifs avec les noms qu'ils d√©crivent. Contrairement au fran√ßais o√π les adjectifs s'accordent en genre et en nombre, les adjectifs polonais doivent correspondre au **rodzaj** (genre), **liczba** (nombre) et **przypadek** (cas) de leurs noms accompagnateurs.

<PhraseOfDay
  polish="Piƒôkna kobieta"
  english="Belle femme"
  pronunciation="PI√âNK-na ko-BI√â-ta"
  context="Remarquez comment 'piƒôkna' se termine par -a pour correspondre au nom f√©minin 'kobieta'."
/>

## Comprendre les bases

En polonais, chaque adjectif doit **s'accorder** avec son nom de trois mani√®res :
- **Rodzaj** (genre) : masculin, f√©minin ou neutre
- **Liczba** (nombre) : singulier ou pluriel
- **Przypadek** (cas) : nominatif, accusatif, g√©nitif, etc.

Cela peut sembler accablant, mais avec de la pratique, ces sch√©mas deviennent naturels pour les couples apprenant ensemble. En fran√ßais, nous n'avons que deux genres et pas de cas grammaticaux, donc c'est une nouveaut√© importante !

## Accord du genre au cas nominatif

Commen√ßons par la forme la plus basique ‚Äì le **mianownik** (cas nominatif) singulier :

<VocabCard
  polish="Wysoki mƒô≈ºczyzna"
  english="Homme grand"
  pronunciation="vi-SO-ki m√®j-TCHIZ-na"
  example="M√≥j mƒÖ≈º to wysoki mƒô≈ºczyzna."
/>

| Genre | Terminaison de l'adjectif | Exemple |
|---|---|---|
| Masculin | **-y** ou **-i** | **wysoki** (grand), **m≈Çody** (jeune) |
| F√©minin | **-a** | **wysoka** (grande), **m≈Çoda** (jeune) |
| Neutre | **-e** | **wysokie** (grand), **m≈Çode** (jeune) |

### Pourquoi deux terminaisons masculines ?

Les adjectifs masculins peuvent se terminer soit par **-y** soit par **-i** selon la consonne pr√©c√©dente :
- Utilisez **-y** apr√®s les consonnes dures : **nowy dom** (nouvelle maison)
- Utilisez **-i** apr√®s les consonnes molles : **≈õwie≈ºy chleb** (pain frais)

<CultureTip flag="üáµüá±" title="Conseil pour apprendre ensemble">
Pratiquez en vous d√©crivant mutuellement ! Dites tour √† tour ¬´ **Jeste≈õ...** ¬ª (Tu es...) suivi d'un adjectif. Votre partenaire peut corriger vos terminaisons avec douceur.
</CultureTip>

## Mod√®les d'adjectifs courants

Voici les adjectifs les plus utiles pour les couples, montrant les trois genres :

<VocabCard
  polish="Piƒôkny/Piƒôkna/Piƒôkne"
  english="Beau/Belle"
  pronunciation="PI√âNK-ni/PI√âNK-na/PI√âNK-n√©"
  example="Masz piƒôkne oczy."
/>

| Fran√ßais | Masculin | F√©minin | Neutre |
|---|---|---|---|
| Intelligent | **mƒÖdry** | **mƒÖdra** | **mƒÖdre** |
| Gentil | **mi≈Çy** | **mi≈Ça** | **mi≈Çe** |
| Dr√¥le | **zabawny** | **zabawna** | **zabawne** |
| Fatigu√© | **zmƒôczony** | **zmƒôczona** | **zmƒôczone** |
| Heureux | **szczƒô≈õliwy** | **szczƒô≈õliwa** | **szczƒô≈õliwe** |

## Les formes plurielles

Quand on d√©crit plusieurs choses, les adjectifs changent encore :

### Pluriel non-masculin personnel
Pour les groupes de femmes, de choses, ou les groupes mixtes (pas que des hommes) :
- La plupart des adjectifs se terminent par **-e** : **m≈Çode kobiety** (jeunes femmes)
- Certains se terminent par **-y** : **dobre ksiƒÖ≈ºki** (bons livres)

### Pluriel masculin personnel
Pour les groupes d'hommes ou les groupes mixtes incluant des hommes :
- Se terminent g√©n√©ralement par **-y** ou **-i** : **m≈Çodzi mƒô≈ºczy≈∫ni** (jeunes hommes)

<VocabCard
  polish="M≈Çodzi ludzie"
  english="Jeunes gens"
  pronunciation="MWO-dji LOU-dj√©"
  example="M≈Çodzi ludzie uczƒÖ siƒô szybko."
/>

## Combinaisons adjectif-nom dans les diff√©rents cas

Les adjectifs doivent aussi changer selon le **cas** de la phrase. Voici comment **dobry** (bon) change avec **student** (√©tudiant ‚Äì masculin) :

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Dobry student"
  meaning="bon √©tudiant"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Nominatif", polish: "dobry student", english: "un bon √©tudiant (sujet)" },
    { person: "Accusatif", polish: "dobrego studenta", english: "un bon √©tudiant (COD)" },
    { person: "G√©nitif", polish: "dobrego studenta", english: "d'un bon √©tudiant" },
    { person: "Datif", polish: "dobremu studentowi", english: "√† un bon √©tudiant" },
    { person: "Instrumental", polish: "dobrym studentem", english: "avec un bon √©tudiant" },
    { person: "Locatif", polish: "dobrym studencie", english: "√† propos d'un bon √©tudiant" }
  ]}
/>

## Exemples pratiques pour les couples

Pratiquons avec des descriptions romantiques que les couples utilisent souvent :

### D√©crire votre partenaire
- **Moja ≈ºona jest piƒôkna** (Ma femme est belle)
- **M√≥j mƒÖ≈º jest przystojny** (Mon mari est beau)
- **Jeste≈õ bardzo mƒÖdra** (Tu es tr√®s intelligente ‚Äì √† une femme)
- **Jeste≈õ bardzo mƒÖdry** (Tu es tr√®s intelligent ‚Äì √† un homme)

### D√©crire des choses ensemble
- **To jest dobre wino** (C'est un bon vin ‚Äì neutre)
- **Mamy nowy samoch√≥d** (Nous avons une nouvelle voiture ‚Äì masculin)
- **Kupi≈Çam nowƒÖ sukienkƒô** (J'ai achet√© une nouvelle robe ‚Äì f√©minin)

<VocabCard
  polish="Romantyczna kolacja"
  english="D√Æner romantique"
  pronunciation="ro-man-TITCH-na ko-LA-tsia"
  example="Przygotowa≈Çem romantycznƒÖ kolacjƒô."
/>

## Types d'adjectifs sp√©ciaux

### Adjectifs possessifs
Ils montrent la possession et doivent s'accorder :
- **m√≥j/moja/moje** (mon/ma/mon)
- **tw√≥j/twoja/twoje** (ton/ta/ton)
- **nasz/nasza/nasze** (notre)

### Adjectifs d√©monstratifs
Les mots pour d√©signer qui changent √©galement :
- **ten/ta/to** (ce/cette/ce)
- **tamten/tamta/tamto** (ce/cette/ce ‚Äì l√†-bas)

<CultureTip flag="üáµüá±" title="Astuce mn√©motechnique">
Souvenez-vous : les adjectifs f√©minins se terminent presque toujours par **-a** au cas nominatif. Cela les rend plus faciles √† rep√©rer et √† apprendre en premier ! C'est similaire au fran√ßais o√π les adjectifs f√©minins prennent souvent un ¬´ e ¬ª.
</CultureTip>

## Erreurs courantes √† √©viter

1. **Oublier l'accord du genre** : Dire ¬´ **piƒôkny kobieta** ¬ª au lieu de ¬´ **piƒôkna kobieta** ¬ª (belle femme)

2. **M√©langer les terminaisons de cas** : Utiliser les formes nominatives dans les phrases √† l'accusatif

3. **Confusion au pluriel** : Ne pas distinguer entre le masculin-personnel et les autres pluriels

## Exercices de pratique pour les couples

> **Exercice 1** : D√©crivez tour √† tour des objets autour de votre maison. Le partenaire A dit le nom, le partenaire B ajoute la forme correcte de l'adjectif.

> **Exercice 2** : Pratiquez les compliments ! Faites-vous des compliments sinc√®res en utilisant l'accord correct des adjectifs.

> **Exercice 3** : D√©crivez vos vacances id√©ales en utilisant des adjectifs. ¬´ **Chcƒô pojechaƒá do piƒôknego miasta** ¬ª (Je veux aller dans une belle ville).

## Construire votre vocabulaire d'adjectifs

Commencez par ces adjectifs essentiels que les couples utilisent fr√©quemment :

| Base polonaise | Fran√ßais | Usage |
|---|---|---|
| **dobry** | bon | **dobre jedzenie** (bonne nourriture) |
| **z≈Çy** | mauvais/f√¢ch√© | **z≈Ça pogoda** (mauvais temps) |
| **du≈ºy** | grand | **du≈ºy problem** (gros probl√®me) |
| **ma≈Çy** | petit | **ma≈Ça kawiarnia** (petit caf√©) |
| **nowy** | nouveau | **nowe mieszkanie** (nouvel appartement) |
| **stary** | vieux | **stare zdjƒôcie** (vieille photo) |

Ma√Ætriser l'accord des adjectifs polonais prend du temps et de la pratique, mais c'est l'un des aspects les plus gratifiants de la langue. Quand vous pourrez dire naturellement ¬´ **Moja ukochana ≈ºona** ¬ª (Ma femme bien-aim√©e) ou ¬´ **Nasz wspania≈Çy zwiƒÖzek** ¬ª (Notre merveilleuse relation) avec une grammaire parfaite, vous ressentirez la vraie beaut√© de l'expression polonaise.

Pour les francophones, le syst√®me d'accord du polonais √©tend ce que vous connaissez d√©j√† en fran√ßais ‚Äì vous ajoutez simplement les cas grammaticaux √† l'√©quation !


<CTA
  text="Pr√™ts √† pratiquer l'accord des adjectifs ensemble ?"
  buttonText="Commencer √† apprendre"
/>

articles.title: Expressions de Mariage en Anglais : Guide Complet pour les Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Le mariage est l'un des moments les plus magiques de la vie d'un couple. Que vous vous mariez dans un pays anglophone, que vous ayez des invit√©s anglophones, ou que vous assistiez au mariage d'amis anglophones, conna√Ætre le vocabulaire du mariage en anglais est essentiel. Ce guide vous accompagne avec les expressions les plus importantes pour vivre pleinement ce jour sp√©cial.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Will you marry me?"
  translation="Veux-tu m'√©pouser ?"
  pronunciation="[ouill you MA-ri mi]"
  context="La question la plus importante de votre vie - √† utiliser au moment de la demande en mariage"
/>

## Les Bases : F√©licitations aux Mari√©s

<VocabCard
  word="Congratulations on your wedding!"
  translation="F√©licitations pour votre mariage !"
  pronunciation="[kon-gra-tchou-LE√è-cheunz on yor OU√à-ding]"
  example="Congratulations on your wedding! May your love grow stronger every day."
/>

### Expressions de F√©licitations

| Anglais | Fran√ßais | Contexte |
|---------|----------|----------|
| Congratulations! | F√©licitations ! | Universel |
| Best wishes to the happy couple! | Meilleurs v≈ìux aux heureux mari√©s ! | Formel |
| Wishing you a lifetime of happiness! | Je vous souhaite une vie de bonheur ! | Sinc√®re |
| May your love story last forever! | Que votre histoire d'amour dure pour toujours ! | Romantique |
| Here's to love and laughter! | √Ä l'amour et au bonheur ! | Toast |

<CultureTip title="Le Toast Traditionnel" flag="üá¨üáß">
